description: a(n) = (1/2)*Sum{|d(i)-e(i)|}, where Sum{d(i)*2^i} is base 2 representation of n and e(i) are digits d(i) in nonincreasing order, for i=0,1,...,m.
comments: a(n) is also the minimum number of bit swap operations that needs to be performed to pack all the bits of n to the right. - _Philippe Beaudoin_, Aug 20 2014a(n) = 0 if A243109(n) = n; 1 + a(A243109(n)) otherwise. - _Philippe Beaudoin_, Aug 20 2014The index of the k-th record of this sequence is A020522(k) and corresponds to k ones followed by k zeros. - _Philippe Beaudoin_, Aug 20 2014
links: Philippe Beaudoin, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
maple: a:= proc(n) local L,m;L:= convert(n,base,2);m:= convert(L,`+`);m - convert(L[1..m],`+`);end proc:seq(a(n),n=1..100); # _Robert Israel_, Aug 20 2014
prog: (PARI) a(n) = {d = binary(n); e = vecsort(d); sum(i=1, #d, abs(d[i]-e[i]))/2;} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Aug 20 2014
author: _Clark Kimberling_
extensions: Definition swapped with A037879. - _R. J. Mathar_, Oct 19 2015
